# 1996 Cape Verdean presidential election

| party1 = Movement for Democracy (Cape Verde)
| popular_vote1 = 81,821
| percentage1 = 92.11%'
| title = President
| before_election = António Monteiro
| before_party = MpD
| after_election = António Monteiro
| after_party = MpD
| map_image       = Elecciones presidenciales de Cabo Verde, 1996.svg
| map_caption = Results by municipality
}}
Presidential elections were held in Cape Verde on 18 February 1996. Only one candidate, incumbent António Mascarenhas Monteiro of the Movement for Democracy, contested the election. He was re-elected with around 92.1% of the vote.
